title: Mont Vully
text:
Mont Vully (653 m; in German also known as "Wistenlacherberg") is a <a href="hill">hill</a> of the <a href="Swiss%20Plateau">Swiss Plateau</a>, located between <a href="Lake%20Morat">Lake Morat</a> and <a href="Lake%20Neuch%C3%A2tel">Lake Neuchâtel</a> in the canton of <a href="Canton%20of%20Fribourg">Fribourg</a>, east of the border with the canton of <a href="Vaud">Vaud</a>.
The south side, overlooking <a href="Murten">Murten</a> and its lake, is covered by vineyards. The north side, overlooking Lake Neuchâtel, is mostly wooded.
